com.turn.ttorrent.protocol.torrent

Class Torrent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.turn.ttorrent.protocol.torrent.Torrent

  • public class Torrent
extends java.lang.Object
    A torrent file tracked by the controller's BitTorrent tracker.

    This class represents an active torrent on the tracker. The torrent information is kept in-memory, and is created from the byte blob one would usually find in a .torrent file.

    Each torrent also keeps a repository of the peers seeding and leeching this torrent from the tracker.

    See Also:
    Torrent meta-info file structure specification

               java.net.URISyntaxException
        Load a torrent from the given torrent file.
        Parameters:
        torrent - The abstract File object representing the .torrent file to load.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the torrent file cannot be read.
        java.net.URISyntaxException

      • Torrent

        public Torrent(@Nonnull
       byte[] torrent)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               java.net.URISyntaxException
        Create a new torrent from meta-info binary data. Parses the meta-info data (which should be B-encoded as described in the BitTorrent specification) and create a Torrent object from it.
        Parameters:
        torrent - The meta-info byte data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the info dictionary can't be read or encoded and hashed back to create the torrent's SHA-1 hash.
        java.net.URISyntaxException

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get this torrent's name.

        For a single-file torrent, this is usually the name of the file. For a multi-file torrent, this is usually the name of a top-level directory containing those files.
